intro: Quercus oxyloba, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to central Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, chestnuts, and beeches. The tree is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and elongated, pointed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. Its acorns are small and hairy, typically maturing in the second year. Quercus oxyloba plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
